knimeNode.name: Spectra Writer
knimeNode.shortDescription: Writes a spectra column out to disk for processing with other Mass Spec. software. Supports MGF format but does not guarantee that all input data will be preserved in the created file.

fullDescription.intro:
This node takes data previously loaded by the Spectra Reader and saves it to disk in the specified format. It will "fake" data which required by the file format but is not loaded into KNIME:
WARNING: this node does not guarantee to preserve all data present in the loaded files as the software is incomplete and imperfect. Use this node at own risk. In particular MGF does not preserve SCANS header lines, even if the input data has it. This can be useful if you are using software which does not support these headers! It will also reorder the headers to support most software packages correctly.
This node can create multiple files based on the chosen column: the filename suffix will be chosen based on a nominal column. Useful for saving multiple MS/MS fractions at once. The suffix can be a column with values like 1, 2, 3, and so on (but it must be a column compatible with strings). It cannot contain path separators (eg. \\ under Windows)
fullDescription.option: The file to save to. If chosen, the suffix will be appended to each file
Spectra column to save eg. from Spectra Reader or Mascot Reader nodes
The node will abort if an attempt is made to overwrite a file unless this option is checked
Only MGF is supported for now, other formats to come soon

Choose none to save a single (combined spectra) file, or to create multiple files with. The column must have no more than approx. 40 different values as this will create too many files to be practically useful.
